comment: "Minus times minus is plus", see also ~ nnmtmip , holds for positive reals, too (formalized to "The product of two negative reals is a positive real"). "The reason for this" in this case is that ` ( -u A x. -u B ) ` ` = ( A x. B ) ` for all complex numbers ` A ` and ` B ` because of ~ mul2neg , ` A ` and ` B ` are complex numbers because of ~ rpcn , and ` ( A x. B ) e. RR+ ` because of ~ rpmulcl . Note that the opposites ` -u A ` and ` -u B ` of the positive reals ` A ` and ` B ` are negative reals. (Contributed by AV, 23-Dec-2022.)
